alert.note: Alert for Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 9:59AM CST until March 03 at 4:18PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Coldwater River near Sarah affecting Tate and Tunica Counties. For the Coldwater River...including Sarah, Marks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coldwater River near Sarah. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Several homes in Marks are flooded. Farmland flooding is widepread. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Thursday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 01/28/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
